sub_title: | Sustainopreneur | EU Lobbyist |  | Erasmus+ Coordinator | Co-Founder CoSE | Speaker | TEDX | Forbes U30 |
summary:
Through Fear one does not Rule, 
But through Love one Leads, 
Setting the example for others to follow.

When I was 15 years old, I remember, I was welding.
Welding in the burning heat and arid smoke of my engineering classroom.

Bent over those scorching sparks, I was told that I would never amount to anything, that I was nothing, that I could not help anyone.  That I could not make the world in which we live a better place.

Those sparks while burning my eyes, ignited a fire within my soul,
A burning passion, to understand, to learn, to seek, and to build.

It inspired me to work, to grow, every single day, to improve both myself, and the world in which we live.

To Build, To Grow, To Learn, and to Teach, every moment that I am alive. 
To take on the global responsibilities, and face new challenge's whenever possible. 

As a Sustainopreneur I now have that chance, to build that Future that we all deserve, 
grateful and honored, yet humbled and contrite, as Mentor, a Teacher, a Student, and a Friend.

And with that mentality, that drive, that passion, I will keep building, 
today, tomorrow, the rest of my life, towards a better future for humanity, 
until my very last day on this earth.

treasury_media.title: Working With Dan Pena, The 50 Billion Dollar Man
treasury_media.description:
As Managment Director of TEDxYouth@Nijmegen, it fell to me to ask Daniel Steven Peña, the 50 Billion Dollar man to attend our TEDxYouth@Nijmegen Event. To teach a new generation of young entrepreneurs, what buisness really means, told by one of the greatest veterans in the field and one of the greatest buisness coaches in the world, al to inspire the future generation.

https://tedxyouthnijmegen.nl/dan-pena/

treasury_media.title: Wageningen University Lecture, ESLOO by Dennis Dorpmans, Excellence also means being passionate and having the courage to fail
treasury_media.description: Sustainability should be a lifestyle and should therefore become a standard part of primary school and university curricula. "After all, the youth of today will be responsible for making the decisions of tomorrow. If this happens with a sustainable mind-set, we can keep our oceans clean and our world liveable," says Dennis Dorpmans, who will deliver a speech on 17 May on the occasion of the Month of Education.

treasury_media.title: The Sustainopreneur
treasury_media.description:
Dennis Dorpmans as Sustainopreneur, speaks at the "Excellence in Middle Level Educational" Congress about Entrepreneurship, Sustainability and opportunity's in the Circular Economy.

https://mbo-today.nl/conferentie-excellentie-kansen-bieden-kansen-pakken/

https://www.mboe.nl/news/article/25

treasury_media.title: Wageningen University Month of Education – How to distinguish yourselves from others?
treasury_media.description: In the context of the Month of Education, ESLOO (European Schools Love Our Ocean) will share their unconventional view on ‘excellence & education’ followed by an elaborate discussion. ESLOO is an initiative aiming for education that creates a sustainability mindset, focusing on students in particular. In cooperation with Socrates Honours Society, the main topic will be how excellence can be achieved through an alternative, ambitious and bold attitude.

treasury_media.title: Public Speaker at the Excellence in Middle Level Education Congress
treasury_media.description: You save the world by doing it.

treasury_media.title: Hoe locale en regionale samenwerking de SDG’s op Europees niveau tot leven brengen
treasury_media.description: De Europese Week van regio’s en steden is een jaarlijks, vier dagen durend evenement in Brussel waarop ambtenaren van regionale en lokale overheden samen met deskundigen en academici goede praktijken en knowhow uitwisselen op het gebied van regionale en stedelijke ontwikkeling. Dit jaar stond het event in het teken van de Sustainable Development Goals (SDG’s) en de rol van steden en hun regio’s hierin.

authors.headline: | Sustainopreneur | EU Lobbyist |  | Erasmus+ Coordinator | Co-Founder CoSE | Speaker | TEDX | Forbes U30 |

profile_positions.description:
Hosting the European Green Week 2019 and organising activities during and after the opening therefore would kick-start the sustainable future of "European Entrepreneurial Region" (EER) Gelderland!


The European Solidarity Corps is an initiative of the European Commission that gives Young professionals the chance to work on projects in the European Member states that benefit the societies and citizens of those Member states.

The European AI Alliance is a multi-stakeholder forum for engaging in a broad and open discussion of all aspects of AI development and its impact on the economy and society. It is steered by the High-Level Expert Group on AI (AI HLG), which consists of 52 experts who have been selected by the Commission for this task. The AI HLG will focus on two main deliverables, for which input from the members of the European AI Alliance will be sought:

It will prepare draft AI ethics guidelines, which will offer guidance on how to implement ethical principles when developing and deploying AI, building on the work of the European Group on Ethics in Science and New Technologies and the European Union Agency for Fundamental Rights.

Futhermore the EU AI Alliance will make mid- and long-term policy recommendations on AI-related challenges and opportunities, to the European Union and its Member States

The European Blue Bioeconomy forum is organised for industries, public agencies, financial organisations, researchers and civil society, working on or interested in the Blue Bioeconomy of the EU – aquatic and marine environments. During the event we will look at the current status of the emerging Blue Bioeconomy in Europe, identify strategic developments, market opportunities, financing possibilities and research priorities. We will discuss challenges for the sustainable production of food, non-food and feed in the Blue Bioeconomy sector. The exchange of ideas is expected to result in formulation of a roadmap for the development of the Blue Bioeconomy in the EU.
profile_positions.title: Organiser EU GreenWeek 2019 EER Gelderland, European AI Alliance & Blue Bioeconomic Forum

profile_positions.description:
Become the mentor you wished you had, when you were their age.
Young students ask. The world’s brightest minds answer. In 100 seconds.

100 Mentors provides school children the opportunity to ask questions to over 4000 of the brightest academics, scientists and experts in academia and business. Professors at Harvard or Cambridge. top scientists at Nasa, or global experts in their respective fields and sectors.

Like my fellow experts as a Sustainopreneur, I will teach young students trough the E-Learning methods of 100 mentors to enrich their vision of the future, and inspire the future generation to help build a better world.
profile_positions.title: Mentor & Teacher

profile_positions.company: Erasmus+ | Onderwijs & Training, Jeugd en Sport
profile_positions.description:
As international Project Leader, I carried the responsibility of planning, organizing, implementing and running Erasmus+ Youth Exchanges Education Projects, throughout and involving multiple member states of Europe.
Via implementation through non profit foundation "Eerlijke Jongeren voor Ouderen" (EJVO) and under contract and in partnership with Erasmus+, the National Agency of the Netherlands "NJI" and Youth organizations from various European countries, a multitude of Erasmus+ projects where implemented to teach youth from Latvia, Spain, Romania, Bulgaria ,Poland and the Netherlands new attributes and skills using alternative education methods.
This done under the mandate of the European Commission, and the Erasmus+ Program to prepare youngsters effectively to handle the challenge's of the coming future.
During these specific projects a substantial focus was placed on sustainability and therefore run under the banner of the Sustainable Development Goals ( SDG's)
profile_positions.title: International Project Lead & Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
As a former MBO (Middle level applied education) student having grown to excel in the field of sustainability I was honored to be a public speaker and masterclass trainer at the "Excellentie in het MBO" (Excellence in middle-level applied education) Yearly Congress.
During this congress I spoke from my experiences as a Sustainopreneur trying to build a better world and future and how to achieve this to an audience of students and teacher of multiple educational facilities. 
Furthermore, afterwards I taught masterclasses on in how to excel with sustainability in middle-level applied education and in your own personal life.
profile_positions.title: Masterclass Trainer & Public Speaker

profile_positions.description:
World Space Week is an international celebration of science and technology, and their contribution to the betterment of the human condition. The United Nations General Assembly declared in 1999 that World Space Week will be held each year from October 4-10.

The world’s leading and largest AI summit gathers the global AI ecosystem of Enterprise, BigTech, Startups, Investors and Science, the brightest brains in AI as speakers every October in Amsterdam.
profile_positions.title: National Coordinator Grand Duchy of Luxembourg & Benelux Hub, Delegate World AI Summit

profile_positions.description: The West Wing is a think-tank connected to the Directie Western Hemisphere (DWH) of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Kingdom of the Netherlands. The think-tank was founded in 2015 and contains students and young professionals with an interests in developing and advising on (foreign) policy.
profile_positions.title: WestWing Alumni Member

profile_positions.description:
A Forbes Community for aspiring and inspiring young movers and shakers out to change the world.
Forbes today launches Forbes Forums, virtual platforms for our communities to engage with one another in a private, invitation-only, off-the-record context. They are designed to provide a safe space for executive peers to come together and share with one another—ideas, concerns, advice, perspective. 
And as such I am a member of the exclusive Forbes Entrepreneur & Small Business Forum.
profile_positions.title: Forbes U30 Europe

profile_positions.description: Bringing only the Best at Branding & Management, and teaching you how to build the best versions of your company's, teams or your self's, and how to further your goals as a public speaker by building your personal brand.
profile_positions.title: Founder & Olympus Manager

profile_positions.description:
As representative of the Netherlands, taking part in the Economic Forum of Young Leaders consisting of representatives and officials from 43 of the EU member states.
To deliberate and discuss the opportunities and challenges that face the future of the European Union and its current and future members.
profile_positions.title: Dutch Representative

profile_positions.description: The Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission (IOC) of UNESCO is pleased to announce the launch of the Ocean Literacy Portal. This Portal has been developed to provide a one-stop shop for ocean literacy worldwide, by sharing existing global ocean knowledge. The resources will be accessible to citizens worldwide, from different backgrounds and of all ages, from students to educators, from researchers to policy makers.
profile_positions.title: Ocean Literacy Portallid "Collaborative Workspace" Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission (IOC)

volunteer_experiences.description: The SDG Charter Network enables business, civil society & local governments in the Netherlands to cooperate effectively in achieving the U.N. Sustainable Development Goals, at home and abroad. The Charter develops an ambitious, positive agenda to achieve the goals. The SDGs are a great opportunity for the Netherlands and the world, if we are able to work together. The SDG Charter has been signed by over 250 parties; companies, civil society & youth organizations, foundations, knowledge institutes and municipalities, that are strongly committed to realizing the 2030 Agenda. This is a unique movement in the world. The Charter Bureau facilitates the network by convening actors and catalyzing cooperation.

The World Economic Forum is the International Organization for Public-Private Cooperation.

The Forum engages the foremost political, business and other leaders of society to shape global, regional and industry agendas.

It was established in 1971 as a not-for-profit foundation and is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland. It is independent, impartial and not tied to any special interests. The Forum strives in all its efforts to demonstrate entrepreneurship in the global public interest while upholding the highest standards of governance. Moral and intellectual integrity is at the heart of everything it does.

Our activities are shaped by a unique institutional culture founded on the stakeholder theory, which asserts that an organization is accountable to all parts of society. The institution carefully blends and balances the best of many kinds of organizations, from both the public and private sectors, international organizations and academic institutions.

The Space Generation Advisory Council in Support of the United Nations Programme on Space Applications is a global non-governmental, non-profit (US 501(c)3) organisation and network which aims to represent university students and young space professionals ages 18-35 to the United Nations, space agencies, industry, and academia. Headquartered in Vienna, Austria, the SGAC network of members, volunteers and alumni has grown to more than 13 000 members representing more than 150 countries.

SGAC was conceived at UNISPACE III in 1999, whereby states resolved, as part of the Vienna Declaration, “To create a council to support the United Nations Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space, through raising awareness and exchange of fresh ideas by youth. The vision is to employ the creativity and vigour of youth in advancing humanity through the peaceful uses space”. SGAC holds Permanent Observer status at the United Nations Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space (UN COPUOS) and regularly takes part in the annual meeting, as well as its Legal and Scientific and Technical Subcommittees. SGAC holds consultative status at the United Nations Economic and Social Council (UN ECOSOC), contributing to discussions on the role of space in achieving the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

volunteer_experiences.role: Hero of the Middle Level Education Campain
volunteer_experiences.description:
Chosen as one of the 6 Middle Level Education Rollmodels by the Dutch National Youth Council (NJR)
I and 5 other participants shared our personal story's of starting at middle level education and growing into the success we have become today. 

I myself shared my personal story, of going from Welder & Metal Engineer to Lobbyist at the European Parliment,  to inspire students of al the Middle Level Education Schools in the County of Utrecht of how through climbing the ranks of the Middle Level Education (MBO) system you can become succesfull, and how I gained my skills and knowledge and through my middle level education journey, built my foundation that allowed me to grow out into the Sustainopreneur I am today.

Middle Level Education Is the linchpin of our world, it is the crafters, the workers, the builders,  it is the reason our cities’ our citizens and our society’s keep functioning.

And all those who pursue middle level education should be proud of doing so, knowing that they build the foundations of our world to work towards a better future that we all deserve.
